value.name: Grand Forks police officer remembered on one-year anniversary of his shooting death
value.description: A memorial service was held Thurs. morning outside the Grand Forks Police Department to honor Officer Cody Holte who died in the line of duty a year ago. Holte was killed in an exchange of gunfire in an apartment building.

value.name: Police shootings of children spark new outcry, calls for training to deal with adolescents in crisis
value.description: A Washington Post database of fatal force incidents finds most children shot by police are minorities and less likely to be armed than adults shot by police.

value.name: Honoring Grand Forks Officer Cody Holte one year later
value.description: Law enforcement and family members gathered outside the Grand Forks Police Department on Thursday morning to pay their respects.

value.name: Land donated for Tuscaloosa County tornado shelter web script
value.description: The Tuscaloosa County Commission could build the first public storm shelter in Duncanville on a piece of land on Duncanville Middle School Road.

value.name: Police Week activities to include parade, Capitol service, headstone ceremony
value.description: Stenehjem and Grand Forks Police Chief Mark Nelson are scheduled to speak. Chaplains from the Crisis Care Chaplaincy will read the roll call of fallen officers. The ceremony is open to the public.

value.name: Police shootings of children spark renewed calls for training on adolescents in crisis
value.description: Stavian Rodriguez squeezed his 15-year-old body through the drive-through window of the Okie Gas Express convenience store, poking his hands out first so police could see that they were empty.
